p: Rehman et al. investigated the aerial parts of Eryngium caeruleum and isolated two new flavone glycosides ( 1 and 2, Figure 1) (Rehman et al., 2017). These two isolated compounds were evaluated for their potential against Î±-glucosidase, aldose reductase (ALR1 and ALR2). Compounds were only found active against ALR1 and ALR2.
